intro: Veronica ruderalis, commonly known as the common speedwell, is a flowering plant in the family Plantaginaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue or violet flowers in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, due to its adaptability. Veronica ruderalis is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is often considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
